resources.string: Waver

Before any spells, you must learn to wield a weapon. Physical violence may be the last resort, but many a wizard owes their life to combat training. Take this knife, and let me see a few practice stabs.
Starting from the lower part of the screen, slide your finger straight up.
Good! Do it again.
Observe using the left half of the screen gives a left-handed stab; similarly, using the right half gives a right-handed stab.
Excellent. Let us move on.
Stab this wooden dummy 3 times to destroy it. Use the motion you just learned, then tap the bottom of the screen to confirm each stab.
Notice you cannot stab with both hands simultaneously. You only have one knife; you can only stab once per turn.
Good job. Beware! You will face armed and dangerous monsters in the next lesson.
Very funny, though strictly speaking you did destroy the dummy. You're lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. Clearly you know how to play, so we'll skip a lesson.
Very funny. You're lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. We'll move on, even though you lost to a wooden dummy.

Did you notice the green line indicating the target? In this fight, you must direct your first stabs to the goblins, who each inflict one point of damage. Drag your finger from the Stab icon to a goblin before ending your turn.
Capital! At last you are ready to learn magic. The first gesture you'll learn is the easiest, but also the most powerful.
Close enough. Let's move on anyway. The first gesture you'll learn is the easiest, but also the most powerful.
You're lucky I know the Raise Dead spell. Let's try that again.
Drag your finger downwards, in the lower part of the screen (the reverse of the Knife gesture). This makes the Palm gesture (P).
Good, try another Palm.
Good, try another Palm.
That's plenty for now.
The Shield spell can be cast with a single Palm. Shield protects you from all physical attacks.
But be warned! Due to its power, gesturing Palm with both hands simultaneously causes you to lose at the end of the round, unless doing so kills your opponent.
A draw is not good enough. With the Shield spell you should be able to win easily.
Well done. But what if the opponent also knows Shield? Listen carefully...
Let's try it again, shall we?
You must remember these 3 points. First, a Wave gesture (W) is executed by running your finger diagonally down the screen and away from the center.
Second, a Fingers gesture (F) is similar, except you run your finger diagonally down the screen and toward the center.
Lastly, cast Cause Light Damage by gesturing W, F, P with the same hand in successive turns. This inflicts 2 damage, even if the target is shielded. Good luck!
Impressive! I have one last lesson for now.
This is a tough fight. Don't lose heart!
I'll let you pass, but remember you won't always have someone around to cast Raise Dead on you.
Firstly, do a Snap gesture (S) by drawing a diagonal that goes up and away from the center, like a Knife gesture that veers outwards.
Secondly, the Digit gesture (D) is the same except you go toward to center.
SD shoots a projectile for 1 damage. SFW summons a goblin to fight for you. DFW restores up to one hit point.
